stanza.line: Lo in the orient when the gracious lightlight
Lifts up his burning head each under eyeeye
Doth homage to his new-appearing sightsight
Serving with looks his sacred majestymajesty
And having climbed the steep-up heavenly hillhill
Resembling strong youth in his middle ageage
Yet mortal looks adore his beauty stillstill
But when from highmost pitch with weary carcar
Like feeble age he reeleth from the dayday
The eyes (fore duteous) now converted areare
From his low tract and look another wayway
So thou thy self out-going in thy noonnoon
Unlooked on diest unless thou get a sonson
